title: F14 Submission Form
description: Schema for the F14 Catalyst Submission Form

2025-01-14: Updated schema to include new fields for submission details.
Fixed validation issues with the URL pattern.
Improved documentation for open source requirements.
Removed references to 'proposal' for clarity and consistency

schemaReferenceNonUI.$comment: NOT UI: used to identify the kind of template document used.

segment.x-note: Major sections of the submission. Each segment contains sections of information grouped together.

section.x-note: Subsections containing specific details about the submission.

singleLineTextEntry.$comment: UI - Single Line text entry without any markup or rich text capability.
singleLineTextEntry.x-note: Enter a single line of text. No formatting, line breaks, or special characters are allowed.

singleLineHttpsURLEntry.$comment: UI - Single Line text entry for HTTPS Urls.
singleLineHttpsURLEntry.x-note: Must start with 'https://' and is followed by one or more non-whitespace characters, ending at the end of the string.

multiLineTextEntry.$comment: UI - Multiline text entry without any markup or rich text capability.
multiLineTextEntry.x-note: Enter multiple lines of plain text. You can use line breaks but no special formatting.

multiLineTextEntryMarkdown.$comment: UI - Multiline text entry with Markdown content.
multiLineTextEntryMarkdown.x-note:
Use Markdown formatting for rich text. Available formatting:
- Headers: # for h1, ## for h2, etc.
- Lists: * or - for bullets, 1. for numbered
- Emphasis: *italic* or **bold**
- Links: [text](url)
- Code: `inline` or ```block```

radioButtonSelect.x-note: Select one option from a list of radio buttons

dropDownSingleSelect.$comment: UI - Drop Down Selection of a single entry from the defined enum.
dropDownSingleSelect.x-note: Select one option from the dropdown menu. Only one choice is allowed.

multiSelect.$comment: UI - Multiselect from the given items.
multiSelect.x-note: Select multiple options from the dropdown menu. Multiple choices are allowed.

singleLineTextEntryList.$comment: UI - A Growable List of single line text (no markup or richtext).
singleLineTextEntryList.x-note: Add multiple single-line text entries. Each entry should be unique and under 1024 characters.

multiLineTextEntryListMarkdown.$comment: UI - A Growable List of markdown formatted text fields.
multiLineTextEntryListMarkdown.x-note: Add multiple markdown-formatted text entries. Each entry can include rich formatting and should be unique.

singleLineHttpsURLEntryList.$comment: UI - A Growable List of HTTPS URLs.
singleLineHttpsURLEntryList.x-note: Enter multiple HTTPS URLs. Each URL should be unique and under 1024 characters.

tagInput.$comment: UI - A tag-style input field for adding/removing items with visual tags
tagInput.x-note: Add or remove items that will be displayed as tags with remove buttons

nestedQuestionsList.$comment: UI - A Growable List of Questions.  The contents are an object, that can have any UI elements within.
nestedQuestionsList.x-note: Add multiple questions. Each question should be unique.

nestedQuestions.$comment: UI - The container for a nested question set.
nestedQuestions.x-note: Add multiple questions. Each question should be unique.

singleGroupedTagSelector.$comment: UI - A selector where a top level selection, gives a single choice from a list of tags.
singleGroupedTagSelector.x-note: Select one option from the dropdown menu. Only one choice is allowed.

tagGroup.$comment: UI - An individual group within a singleGroupedTagSelector.
tagGroup.x-note: Select one option from the dropdown menu. Only one choice is allowed.

tagSelection.$comment: UI - An individual tag within the group of a singleGroupedTagSelector.
tagSelection.x-note: Select one option from the dropdown menu. Only one choice is allowed.

tokenValueCardanoADA.$comment: UI - A Token Value denominated in Cardano ADA.
tokenValueCardanoADA.x-note: Enter the amount of Cardano ADA to be used in the submission.

durationInMonths.$comment: UI - A Duration represented in total months.
durationInMonths.x-note: Enter the duration of the submission in months.

yesNoChoice.$comment: UI - A Boolean choice, represented as a Yes/No selection.  Yes = true.

agreementConfirmation.$comment: UI - A Boolean choice, defaults to `false` but its invalid if its not set to `true`.

languageCode.$comment: UI - A Language Code (e.g. 'en', 'es', 'fr', etc.) selection.
languageCode.x-note: Select the language code that represents the language of your content.

borderGroup.$comment: UI - Border Group for better UI rendering

titleText.x-guidance: The title should clearly express what the submission is about. Voters can see the title in the voting app, even without opening the submission, so a clear, unambiguous, and concise title is very important.
titleText.x-placeholder: Summarize your submission in 60 characters or less

applicant.x-placeholder: Enter the full name of the primary applicant

type.description: Are you delivering this project as an individual or as an entity (whether formally incorporated or not)
type.x-guidance:
Please select from one of the following:

1. Individual
2. Entity (Incorporated)
3. Entity (Not Incorporated)
type.x-placeholder: Select whether you're applying as an individual or entity

coproposers.title: Co-proposers and additional applicants
coproposers.x-guidance: List any persons who are submitting the proposal jointly with the main applicant. Make sure you have confirmed approval/awareness with these individuals/accounts before adding them. If there is more than one proposer, identify the lead person who is authorized to act on behalf of other co-proposers. **IMPORTANT** A maximum of 6 (six) proposals can be led or co-proposed by the same applicant or enterprise. Please, reference Fund 14 rules for added detail.

problemDescription.description: Describe the problem your project aims to solve
problemDescription.x-guidance: Ensure you present a well-defined problem. What is the core issue that you hope to fix? Remember: the reader might not recognize the problem unless you state it clearly. This answer will be displayed on the Catalyst voting app, so voters will see it even if they don't open your submission to read it in detail.
problemDescription.x-placeholder: Describe the problem you aim to solve

solutionSummary.title: Solution Summary

milestones.title: Project Milestones
milestones.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
milestones.x-guidance:
Please follow these guidelines to build your individual milestones. Each milestone must include:

1. **Milestone Outputs**
   - What will be delivered

2. **Acceptance Criteria**
   - What conditions must be met

3. **Evidence of Completion**
   - How you will prove the milestone is complete.

milestone_list.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
milestone_list.description: Your requested budget requires a minimum of 3 milestones. However you can add additional milestones, please confirm how many milestones you would like to submit.
milestone_list.x-guidance:
**Milestone Requirements:**

- For Grant Amounts of up to 75k ada: at least 2 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**3 milestones in total**)
- For Grant Amounts over 75k ada up to 150k ada: at least 3 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**4 milestones in total**)
- For Grant Amounts over 150k ada up to 300k ada: at least 4 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**5 milestones in total**)
- For Grant Amounts exceeding 300k ada: at least 5 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**6 milestones in total**)

categoryRules.title: Category Rules
categoryRules.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

answer.title: Does your proposal involve informational content, such as websites, blogs, or similar media?
answer.x-guidance: Informational content like websites or blogs is not eligible for this category. Focus on real-world utility and adoption. If your project is primarily informational, consider a different category.
answer.description: Proposals for informational content, such as websites or blogs, are prohibited. This category prioritizes real-world adoption and utility-driven projects.

answer.title: Is your proposal for foundational R&D or maintenance of Cardano infrastructure (e.g., wallets, explorers, or bridges)?
answer.x-guidance: Foundational R&D or infrastructure maintenance (e.g., wallets, bridges, explorers) should apply to a category focused on infrastructure funding, not this one.
answer.description: This category does not cover foundational R&D or ongoing maintenance of Cardano infrastructure (e.g., wallets, explorers, bridges). These are better suited to categories specifically addressing infrastructure needs.

answer.title: Does your project propose funding for liquidity, loans, buying NFTs, or other financial/token-based products?
answer.x-guidance: Financial/token-based proposals like liquidity funding, loans, or NFT purchases are ineligible. Focus on real-world applications of Cardano technology.
answer.description: Proposals requesting funding for liquidity, loans, or token-based financial products, including NFT purchases, are not within scope.

answer.title: Does your proposal focus on a brand-new or early-stage product that is not at least released to an MVP stage?
answer.x-guidance: Proposals must enhance existing, deployed products or involve enterprise partnerships. Early-stage ideas without an MVP should apply to a different category.
answer.description: Only projects with an existing product at MVP stage or beyond are eligible. Early-stage ideas should seek funding in more general innovation categories.

answer.title: Does your proposal primarily involve developer tools, middleware, APIs, or IDEs?
answer.x-guidance: Developer tooling projects should apply to a developer-focused category, such as 'Cardano Open: Developers.' This category emphasizes adoption-driven use cases.
answer.description: Developer tools, middleware, APIs, and IDEs fall outside the scope of this category. These projects should seek funding under developer-specific categories.

answer.title: Is your proposal led by or in partnership with an established enterprise or team with a proven business track record?
answer.x-guidance: Proposals must demonstrate enterprise experience and proven success. Include details about your team or partner's expertise.
answer.description: Proposals must be led by established enterprises or teams with proven business track records. This ensures credibility and feasibility.

question.description: What is the name of the enterprise or team, and what is their track record in the industry?

answer.title: Does your project have a working product or measurable adoption metrics?
answer.x-guidance: Proposals should enhance existing products with measurable success. Include adoption metrics or examples of real-world use.
answer.description: Proposals should demonstrate a working product and measurable adoption. Projects without existing success metrics are not eligible.

question.description: Provide a brief description of your product and its current adoption metrics.

answer.title: Does your proposal include a timeline for delivery within 12 months?
answer.x-guidance: Projects must be delivered within 12 months. Include a clear timeline with milestones for evaluation.
answer.description: All projects must be completed within 12 months. Proposals must include a detailed timeline with key milestones.

answer.title: Does your proposal include matching funds or in-kind contributions?
answer.x-guidance: Matching funds or contributions enhance feasibility and impact. Be transparent about sources and amounts.
answer.description: Proposals with matching funds or in-kind contributions are prioritized for funding due to their higher feasibility and potential impact.

question.description: Provide details on the matching funds or contributions, including their source and value.

answer.title: Does your proposal showcase high adoption potential with measurable outcomes?
answer.x-guidance: Proposals must drive tangible adoption with measurable results. Include metrics and methods for evaluating success.
answer.description: Projects must demonstrate high adoption potential and outline measurable outcomes. Metrics for success should be included.

question.description: What measurable outcomes do you aim to achieve, and how will you assess success?
